node.title: Queensland’s mask mandate could ease soon as 80 per cent single-dose vaccination nears
node.alt: A man in a face mask stares out a window
node.description: As Queensland edges closer to its 80 per cent single-dose COVID-19 vaccination milestone, Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has flagged potential changes to the mask mandate.
node.content:
["As Queensland edges closer to the 80 per cent single-dose COVID-19 vaccination milestone, Queensland Premier\u00a0Annastacia Palaszczuk has flagged potential changes to the mask mandate.", "Ms Palaszczuk said the state was set to hit 80 per cent of the eligible population aged over 16 years with the first dose of a vaccine by Tuesday.", "In August, as the state's south-east grappled with a large COVID outbreak in Indooroopilly, former chief health officer\u00a0Dr Jeannette Young warned Queenslanders that masks could be mandatory until Christmas, unless\u00a0there was higher vaccination coverage.", "Dr Young said masks had made \"an enormous difference\" and were \"critical\" with helping contain the highly-infectious Delta variant.", "However, as more Queenslanders roll up their sleeves for their vaccination,\u00a0Ms Palaszczuk on Sunday hinted mask restrictions could be lifted before that December date.", "\"Especially when we get to that 80 per cent [single-dose vaccination mark],\" Ms Palaszczuk said.", "\"So we'll have more to say about that this week,\" she said.", "Residents living in Brisbane, Ipswich, Logan the Gold Coast, the Sunshine Coast, Noosa, Redlands, Moreton Bay, the Scenic Rim, the Lockyer Valley and Somerset regions are subject to the mask mandate.", "In those local government areas, masks are necessary at stadiums, public transport or ride-sharing, airports, domestic or international flights\u00a0and anywhere people\u00a0cannot\u00a0socially distance.", "The general rule of thumb is to always have a mask on you when you leave home.", "Ms Palaszczuk said she was confident the state was on track to reach key vaccination milestones.", "\"I'm quite sure that we're going to see those last remaining Queenslanders come out and do it for themselves, their family and their community,\" she\u00a0said.", "Almost 67 per cent of eligible Queenslanders have\u00a0now had their second dose of a\u00a0COVID-19 vaccination.", "", "
Outbreak: How Australia lost control of the Delta variant
"]
